exercise.title: 03.06 JSBin

p.i: JSBin is a handy tool for trying out some JavaScript code and sharing the code with others.

ol.li: Open the page http://jsbin.com and close the light blue ad on the top of the page.

If you do not have a JSBin username yet, then click on 'Login or Register' to create a username for yourself. By logging in, you can later access all your previous code that is saved on the JSBin site.

Next, you create a new Bin. Make sure that 'Auto-run JS' is checked on the Output tab. In the HTML tab, write a new

header element into as follows:

Hello

Open the JavaScript tab. In the JavaScript tab, write the following code to programmatically append more text to the myTitle element:
document.getElementById("myTitle").innerHTML += " world!";

exercise.p:
Finally, submit a link to your Bin. Below is an example of a link to a Bin.
http://jsbin.com/asdfqwerty/edit?html,css,js,output
